flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=2.5>>2.5 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500*$.2.5=$1250<<500*2.5=1250>>1250 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500*$.0.5=$250<<500*0.5=250>>250 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $1250+$250=$1500<<1250+250=1500>>1500 total.
#### 1500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 0.25, not 2.5. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
